Author: pg
Content:
It was really pounding the server. Crawling for a search index is ok, but retrieving pages to dynamically update stuff generates a lot of requests.

If you can tell me what you think is missing from News, I can try to add it.

Author: pchristensen
Content: I found this out by emailing him yesterday.  I thought it would be better if I made the case for reinstating it by telling pg the value it creates for me while using his site.  Kartik had nothing to do with this public request.

Author: dpapathanasiou
Content:
On a tangential note, where does one go to find topless babes interested in linux?

The last time I saw topless women on the beach, they were reading "People" magazine if they were reading anything at all.

Author: dpapathanasiou
Content:
Are you sure YC is blocking hystry?

The hystry blog makes no mention of anything like that.

It might be that Kartik just stopped running it, for whatever reason.

Note that the last blog entry was back in November, so maybe he's just moved on to something else, e.g.

Author: Tichy
Content: If I remember correctly from "Collapse" by Jared Diamond, a lot of human societies have been conquered and destroyed in human history. Kind of the same thing, technologically advanced people discover backwards people and finish them off.

Author: mrtron
Content:
Even if you aren't going to get fired, random breasts on the screen is not great for a lot of public situations.

NSFW applies to more than just the fellow with 3 levels of management (and his TPS reports) :)

Author: sabat
Content: Learning #1: "learning" is not a noun. You can't have "learnings". You can have knowledge. You can learn things. Saying you have "learnings" makes you sound retarded.

Author: jeffreypriebe
Content:
I'll also chime in for Jungledisk. I use it on 2 machines at home and a few at work (Windows Vista, Server 2003). The cost and security is really nice.

Jungledisk Plus gives you the option to view files online - so it's a backup + online viewing option (since it uses Amazon S3 and is already online).

Author: inklesspen
Content:
Assuming it is feasible to accelerate a ship to relativistic speeds, they could well decide to exterminate us in self-defense. A relativistic bomb delivers enormous destructive power, and by definition, it is never where you see it when you see it, and is probably unstoppable.

http://www.projectrho.com/rocket/rocket3aa.html#killingstar has a very good writeup on the subject.

Author: dpapathanasiou
Content:
I was suspicious of this story, too, for the same reason, and that's why I added the "possible" qualifier to the title.

Still, it's fascinating to think of the possibilities if it's real.

Author: rokhayakebe
Content:
I think any civilization that is a tiny bit more advanced than us (and trust me it really isn't that hard) would wipe us out of the universe, and i personaly would not blame them. you have to sit back and think who would want to share the universe with creatures who hate, envy, kill their own, lies, cheats, destroys their once perfect habitat, pollutes, steals....

anyways my message to you the aliens is "back the fk off before you contract Humanitis. your most advanced doctors would NEVER be able to cure it"

Author: dpapathanasiou
Content:
I'm not sure the MySQL figure is too high.

Compared to Oracle's market cap of $113 billion, MySQL is a relative bargain.

And while their business models are different, Sun is in a position to make a major dent in Oracle's client base.

With Sun behind them, it's easier for big enterprise customers to go along with MySQL instead of Oracle; support costs for using MySQL are also cheaper.

The net effect will be more profits for Sun overall.

Author: dfranke
Content: This might be useful in the mode where you can deploy it on your own server, but I'm not touching their my.anyterm service.  Why should I consider them more trustworthy than Hushmail?

Author: maw
Content:
You got it right. http://forge.mysql.com/wiki/Code_Contributing_FAQ has more information.

Other companies with a split proprietary/free model require copyright assignments for contributions as well. So, too, does the FSF, although for rather different reasons.
